intro: Melampyrum bihariense var. kuemmerlei, commonly known as the Kashmir flameflower, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Pakistan. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The species is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant has a short life cycle and is often found in association with other herbaceous flora in alpine environments.
